designScenario.name: Fluid Reservoir
designScenario.description: The Fluid Reservoir is a mission-critical component in modern aircraft hydraulic systems, engineered to store, condition, and distribute hydraulic fluid under extreme operational conditions. It features advanced thermal management, real-time fluid quality monitoring, and adaptive pressure regulation to support next-generation fly-by-wire systems, thrust vectoring controls, and high-cycle actuation systems. The reservoir maintains fluid integrity across -65°F to 275°F operational envelopes while withstanding 9g maneuver loads.

details.description: The reservoir shall automatically adjust fluid volume compensation for thermal expansion/contraction and altitude-induced pressure changes through active bladder systems.
Maintain system pressure within ±2% of setpoint across 800-5500 psi operational range, with <100ms response time to transient demands from flight control actuators.
Triple-redundant burst protection with fail-safe isolation valves to prevent catastrophic fluid loss during overpressure events exceeding 125% MAWP (Maximum Allowable Working Pressure).
Integrated prognostic health monitoring system capable of predicting filter life, seal degradation, and fluid quality with 95% accuracy using multi-parameter sensor fusion.

systemComponents.name: Primary Fluid Chamber
systemComponents.description: Monolithic composite structure with titanium reinforcement rings, designed for 2:1 burst-to-yield ratio and corrosion resistance to MIL-H-5606/83282 fluids

subComponents.name: Variable Geometry Bladder
subComponents.description: Fluorosilicone elastomer expansion membrane with shape memory alloy actuators for active volume control

subComponents.name: Cryogenic Baffle Array
subComponents.description: Phase-change material heat exchangers for thermal stabilization during high-altitude operations

systemComponents.name: Fluid Conditioning Module
systemComponents.description: Triple-redundant parallel filtration train with 3μm absolute particulate removal and electrostatic deaerators

subComponents.name: Chip Detector Array
subComponents.description: Multi-spectral ferrous/non-ferrous particle sensors with real-time debris analysis

subComponents.name: Dielectric Moisture Trap
subComponents.description: Hydroscopic molecular sieve maintaining fluid water content <200ppm

relationships.description: The bladder system is integrally mounted within the primary chamber's expansion volume cavity
Conditioned fluid output is directly coupled to the main hydraulic pump suction port via hardline interface
Particle count data feeds into the aircraft's central maintenance system for component life prediction

attributes.name: thermalOperatingRange
attributes.description: Full operational temperature spectrum with maintained viscosity control

attributes.name: contaminantLevel
attributes.description: Maximum allowable particulate contamination per AS4059 standards

attributes.name: materialComposition
attributes.description: Titanium-composite layered construction for optimal strength-to-weight ratio

attributes.name: diagnosticInterval
attributes.description: Real-time prognostic health monitoring with 50ms sampling rate

requirements.name: DynamicFluidManagement
requirements.text: Automatically adjust fluid volume compensation for thermal/altitude changes via active bladder system

requirements.name: AdaptivePressureRegulation
requirements.text: Maintain ±2% pressure accuracy across 800-5500psi with <100ms response

comments.body: Integrates phase-change material baffles for -65°F cryogenic operation and SMA-actuated bladder for volume compensation
